title: Criticism of the Western Civilization - Collection 42 (a Man Was
description:
Criticism of the Western Civilization - Collection 42 (a Man Was Made God):

The West has always been identified by its adoption of Christianity and the corruption of its beliefs. The elevation of Jesus to be God Incarnate, Son of God, a Deity in the Trinity, ..etc is one of these corruptions that has its roots in pagan mythology. It is probably understandable for the people in the middle ages to accept and believe this myth; but, we are in the 21st century, the information age, and it is amazing that many people still believe that Jesus is their God or Lord. 

Here, we have 24 titles:

-  Armstrong - The Trinity and the Incarnation (1904)

-  Burnap - Lectures on the Doctrines of Christianity, in Controversy between Unitarians and Other Denominations of Christianity (1848)

-  Clemen - Primitive Christianity and Its Non-Jewish Sources (1912)

-  Conway - Behold the Man; Jesus and Greco-Roman Masculinity (2008)

-  Crisp - God Incarnate; Explorations in Christology (2009)

-  Dunn - Did The First Christians Worship Jesus; the New Testament Evidence (2010)

-  Ehrman - How Jesus Became God; the Exaltation of a Jewish Preacher from Galilee (2014)

-  Fruchtenbaum - Jesus Was a Jew (2009)

-  Hattersley - Socrates and Jesus; the Argument That Shaped Western Civilization (2009)

-  Hudson - Becoming God; the Doctrine of Theosis in Nicholas of Cusa (2007)

-  Jackson - Pagan Origins of the Christ Myth (1941)

-  Janz - God, the Mind's Desire; Reference, Reason and Christian Thinking (2004)

-  Jenkins - Jesus Wars; How Four Patriarchs, Three Queens, and Two Emperors Decide What Christians Would Believe (2010)

-  Massey - The Historical Jesus and Mythical Christ; a Lecture

-  Meyers - Saving Jesus from the Church; How to Stop Worshiping Christ and Start Following Jesus (2009)

-  Milton on the Son of God and the Holy Spirit - from His Treatise 'On Christian Doctrine' (1908)

-  Moule - The Origin of Christology (1977)

-  Murphy - Jesus Potter Harry Christ (2011)

-  Rubenstein - When Jesus Became God; the Epic Fight over ChristÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Divinity in the Last Days of Rome (1999)

-  Sanders - The Historical Figure of Jesus (1993)

-  Seznec - The Survival of the Pagan Gods; The Mythological Tradition and its Place in Renaissance Humanism and Art (1953)

-  Stauffer - Christ and the Caesars; Historical Sketches (1955)

-  Talbert - The Development of Christology During the First Hundred Years (2011)

-  Wright - Simply Jesus; a New Vision of Who He Was, What He Did, and Why He Matters (2011)

Note the other uploads that are relevant to the same subject here: 'Criticism of Trinity Doctrine', ' Emperors & The Making of Christian Doctrine', 'Priestcraft and Pagan Christianity',and 'The Nature of Jesus - Lord, Prophet or Legend'.
